CatDescriptText: Mrs. Darlene Mays, Beltzhoover, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 11, 1962, pg. 7 with question: "What is the best way to end nuclear testing?" Answer reads: "Personally, I don't think there will be a stop.  They are using the tests as a means to obtain better and better bombs.  It seems inevitable that there will be war.  They probably will be testing in space when they reach there."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Darlene Mays wearing sunglasses and floral dress, holding dark purse, posed in front of H. Alexander & Co. Stationary, Wood Street, Downtown
